adrFormatAddress: 345 W 35th St, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Bright rooms in a funky modern lodging offering an airy lobby bistro & a 24-hour fitness center.

originalText.text:
If you are looking for customer service, look elsewhere.
We checked in in the early hours and the hotel system was down.   The front desk person could not tell us if the 2 rooms we reserved would be on the same floor or close by  He need to walk us to the room and open with a key since the system is down, they can not make key cards.  They copied the ID and credit card.  No going over the amenities, hours, bar/food options, check out time etc.  He could care less.  Checked in the next morning and they cancelled the second room not knowing it and no e-mail stating that to address ASAP.  The last day, someone who knocked on our room door with the do not disturb sign asked us how long we would be since check out was at 11am.   She explained that after an hour it is a fee.  Again speaking to the front desk person, he could care even less than the first person we first interacted with at check in.  He knew only to charge after 12pm.  He advise to call Wyndham.  Wyndham is in the name of TRYP ad he couldn't do anything to assist us at all.  Of all the things we did and experienced, this lack of customer service from every person sitting at that desk must have been taught.  I'm sure there is a good reason that the plexiglass is there, they feel too comfortable being A holes.
I do not recommend this hotel.

originalText.text: My stay is just ok, didn't use any service. Location is great, the price is decent but I could have pick up a place with better amenities. There's no coffee, just tea and you need to get your water for the tea. Elevator will will go up even though you press down and no one is up. the only good thing is it's near the police station so I feel more safe walking past midnight.

text.text: My stay is just ok, didn't use any service. Location is great, the price is decent but I could have pick up a place with better amenities. There's no coffee, just tea and you need to get your water for the tea. Elevator will will go up even though you press down and no one is up. the only good thing is it's near the police station so I feel more safe walking past midnight.

originalText.text: My husband & I were pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed our stay here. We came in on Halloween & checked out November 4th. The staff is super friendly. When we asked for something, it was delivered very quickly. Love that the room had a mini fridge because we could keep a cold bottle of water for our medications. And the walk in shower was very nice w/amazing water pressure! I’d give this hotel above 5 stars if I could. We will definitely be back! Thank you to the staff there that made our stay an awesome experience.

text.text: My husband & I were pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed our stay here. We came in on Halloween & checked out November 4th. The staff is super friendly. When we asked for something, it was delivered very quickly. Love that the room had a mini fridge because we could keep a cold bottle of water for our medications. And the walk in shower was very nice w/amazing water pressure! I’d give this hotel above 5 stars if I could. We will definitely be back! Thank you to the staff there that made our stay an awesome experience.

originalText.text: Unfortunately we planned a last minute holiday trip and had very limited options. I went with this place due to location. The reviews are confusing- some hotel sites rate it much higher which makes me feel they are paying for positive reviews. The location is near police so it feel safer than other areas. Also close to Times Square but far enough away for comfort. Near a lot of hot spots.  We arrived at 4:30pm and they told us our room was not ready and it would be a few hours. They offered to hold our bags in a wide open area that anyone can access so we declined and waited at the bar/food area. They have a subpar food buffet for breakfast and nothing is complimentary- I mean nothing. They constantly try to give bottled water so they can charge you. They do not go out of their way to provide any sort of customer service. Our TV was broken- they didn’t care. We have small kids and TV would have saved the day at certain moments.  I will say that a few of the staff members were kind but 85% were just rude. They have a lot of work to do…Pay the extra and stay elsewhere.

originalText.text: Reading earlier reviews made me nervous, but our experience was great!  We were welcomed pleasantly and efficiently.  Everything worked fine.  We had a drink at the bar one evening and the bartender was excellent.  The maid noticed when we needed things replenished without our asking.  Easy access to the city - subway, Times Square, shows, shopping.
